work.name: ANSYS Germany GmbH
work.summary: Contributed to the KI Data Tooling project at ANSYS Germany GmbH in Munich.
highlights: Generated virtual sensor data using Ansys tools.
Implemented LiDAR simulations for KI Data Tooling and produced synthetic data.

work.name: Infineon Technologies AG
work.summary: Engaged in electromagnetic field simulations and analysis at Infineon Technologies AG in Munich.
highlights: Conducted field simulations using Keysight Momentum and Cadence Virtuoso.
Compared simulation results with DC measurements up to 110 GHz using MATLAB.
Reprocessed raw measurements and analyzed discrepancies between simulations and actual outcomes.

work.name: TEKFEN Engineering
work.summary: Contributed to the TANAP project at TEKFEN Engineering in Istanbul with a focus on electrical components.
highlights: Worked on electrical aspects of the TANAP project using AutoCAD and Excel.
Conducted station analyses, electrical calculations, and data compilation for distribution boards.

work.name: TU München, Institute for Measurement Systems and Sensor Technology & ANSYS Germany GmbH
work.summary: Conducted research on LiDAR-based 3D Object Detection enhancement for autonomous vehicles, supervised by multiple experts at TU München and ANSYS Germany GmbH.
highlights: Explored enhancement techniques for LiDAR-based detection using Ansys AVxcelerate CarMaker Co-Simulation.
Optimized Pointpillars network performance with integrated and fine-tuned techniques.
Proposed a hybrid training approach combining synthetic and real-world data.
Generated a synthetic KITTI dataset replica, extracted bounding boxes, and assessed performance metrics.

work.name: TU München, Associate Professorship of Environmental Sensing and Modeling
work.summary: Contributed to 'Wind Error Analysis in the Bayesian Inversion Framework' research under expert supervision at TU München.
highlights: Conducted wind error analysis using MATLAB and R.
Managed large-scale jobs on a SLURM cluster with various data tools.

work.name: Bogazici University, Antennas and Propagation Research Laboratory
work.summary: Modeled implantable antennas for post-op infection prevention
highlights: Evaluated antennas for microwave hyperthermia-induced biofilm prevention.
Developed a miniaturized antenna prototype and conducted thermal measurements

work.name: RWTH Aachen, Medical Information Technology
work.summary: Developed a system to study impedance distortions in capacitive ECG.
highlights: Designed a system to detect physiological vibrations' impact on coupling impedance.
Created MATLAB scripts for data acquisition using DSP techniques.
Conducted experiments on healthy subjects for system validation.

work.name: Technische Universität München
work.summary: TA for System Theory of the Senses and Signal Processing for Audio Technology

work.name: Technische Universität München
work.summary: TA for System Theory of the Senses

education.area: M.Sc, Electrical Engineering and Information Technology
